website_summaries.verdict: A large dry bag that can stand up to a lot of wear and tear without breaking or leaking.
cons: There have been some complaints of the phone case leaking in water

customer_reviews.title: Best waterproof phone case ever!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the cell phone case. Probably the best review I could give anything. We went kayaking and my phone was in this case and it fell in the water. I wasn't able to find it. I was very upset. 9 days later (yes I said 9 DAYS LATER) someone so graciously found my phone in the North fork river of the Ozarks. She took it out of the case and charged it. It was completely dry! And it turned on and worked like new. I am definitely recommending this for anyone's phone. Thank God all my pics and videos were saved.
customer_reviews.author: K Safranek

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: We spent a week in Kauai, and the bag saw ocean water, sand, river water, and rain. The contents of the bag remained perfectly dry under all conditions. I like the larger size as it was able to accommodate 2 beach towels, sun block, cell phones, wallets, and snacks with room to spare. This is a good product and I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John Paradiso

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag used for snorkeling.
customer_reviews.text: Great dry bag. Used this on a trip to the Riviera Maya. Stuffed our belongings and went snorkeling with the back pack on. It floated and didn't feel it since it floats. Kept our stuff dry and we didn't need to leave anything on the beach. The trick to keeping water out is rolling it correctly and then twist the ends once more to tighten the seal before clipping together. The picture is not great but we were in the water so that was the best one we could take. The pink color really stands out as well.
customer_reviews.author: E Gahbler

customer_reviews.title: Redemption!!
customer_reviews.text: So I was stoked about this bag and got it a few days before floating the river for my birthday. Unfortunately, the buckle was defective an dwould not clasp. I left the seller feedback about my disappointment and the timing of it all. And to my pleasant surprise, the day of my bday and the day of the float a replacement one arrived legit 45 min before we left to go float!!!!! They saved the day and had empeccable timing!!!! Thank u! You rock!!
customer_reviews.author: hybridaznchick

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with my new bag
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my new bag. I tested the bag at home a couple of times and there was no evidence of water inside. I took it to my hike in The Narrows in Utah. My husband fell 2 times in the water and none of the items got wet. I love this bag. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: The 20L is much bigger than I expected. Big enough to hold 2 pairs of shoes, change of clothes, towel, and cellphone, DSLR camera, & wallet. It is a very thick plastic that I see holding up well for my trip to the south pacific.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rodeback

customer_reviews.title: Great bage, great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, the bag is well made I have submerged it and have found it to be waterproof. I am a flight medic in Alaska and I bought this bag to protect my survival gear. I am looking forward to taking this bag into harsh environments around the world. This bag is very competively priced and they included a case for my phone. You can’t beat this deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: but it worked perfect and allowed me to work my phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone Dry Bag: Have used this once since receiving it, realized that I need to take my phone case off, otherwise it creates a bond with the plastic that makes it hard to get my phone out, but it worked perfect and allowed me to work my phone. The Waterproof Bag is a great size for having on a kayak or paddleboard and does exactly what it says it does. This is going to get plenty of use!
customer_reviews.author: GoNavyMAN

customer_reviews.title: Here are the dimensions for 20L Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: Bag seems very well made, the extra handle will be useful. I havent used it on my trip yet, but want to post some measurements of the 20L Dry Bag. Flattened and right out of the delivery box, it measures 26" long, 15" across the opening, and approximately 9.5" across the rounded bottom. Once rolled 3 times and secured, you're left with about 18"-19" of storage space. This bag is a little narrower than I was expecting but works for my needs and I actually prefer it. I included a photo with a standard wine bottle for size comparison. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: SH/MD

customer_reviews.title: This bag works great and it’s pretty comfortable to carry
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great and it’s pretty comfortable to carry. I use this bag to the beach and all wet hikes. I hiked over 10miles with this bag and it worked well! I was able to carry over a liter of water, camera, snacks and with space to spare when hiking. The material is thick and sturdy. Not to mention the phone pouch works well! I was hesitate to use it but it protected my iPhone 8 just fine with no water inside. This is a must have if you are out door person.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely808

customer_reviews.title: There were very cool instructions to test the phone case before actual use ...
customer_reviews.text: The bags arrived as advertised. There were very cool instructions to test the phone case before actual use and information how to return anything defective. I followed the directions to submerge the phone case in water for an hour to test for any water leaks. The case remained dry and now feel very confident to use during kayaking trips. Very friendly customer service. For the price you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm, just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We used the dry bags while sailing around the Bahamas last week. We kept beach towels, wallets & cell phones dry during the occasional rain and for dinghy rides to the beach. But we really put them to the test when our kayak flipped over trapping the bags under water for 15+ minutes in rough current. Everything inside stayed perfectly dry!
customer_reviews.author: PVinSD

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this bag
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this bag! I'm using it camping and boating and it carries everything I need and I have no worries about anything getting wet inside the bag at all. I tested the phone case, per the instructions, except I forgot about it and left it submerged for about 1 hour 15 minutes! No problem, the inside stayed dry, no leaks. No more worries about your phone, wallet, etc. getting ruined when using this bag and case.
customer_reviews.author: RogerB

customer_reviews.title: Very dry - seems pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd 10 litre dry bay i've had. This one is made from a seemingly rubberized material that definitely rejects the water. It's slightly stiffer & harder to burp & roll up than the one i had before. Contents do stay dry. I wouldn't hesitate to put a small camera in here, though it sits in the bottom of my kayak where there is a constant drip - drip from the paddle, so it's always sitting in a puddle. Inclusion of the phone case makes it an outstanding deal.
customer_reviews.author: MurrayH77

customer_reviews.title: ... a week long wilderness canoe trip and it was perfect. Tough
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a week long wilderness canoe trip and it was perfect. Tough, dependable, and most importantly kept my clothes clean and dry through all sorts of wet, soaking conditions. I have confidence mine will last for years to come. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: So far, better than good!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent looking product, very heavy duty. The two bags I ordered both came with a gift - a dry bag to fit a cell phone, that I was not expecting. This is a very clever product. I gifted them to two kite board enthusiasts and they were thrilled. I'll try my big bag on a trip next month and update here on how it works strapped to the back of my BMW R1200GS.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed.  Doesn't seem to leak.  Handy for many uses.  Laundry.  Beach essentials.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to SE Asia. Have used it to take beach towels and other beach gear to the beach, took it on boat trip to Andaman Islands, used it to soak clothes with permethrin anti-mosquito solution and used it to wash clothes in hotel rooms. It hasn't leaked, it works great as a wash bag for laundering clothes at a fraction of the price for a "dedicated" laundry wash bag. I probably could have gotten by with 15 liter size, but other than the bulk in our suitcases, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: BrianLTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Seller accurately described this product and it arrived right on time. This is the second one I purchased to use in my boat. Funny story - just after I bought this one for myself, my friend informed that she had bought another for me for Christmas! They are very sturdy and take a lot of wear and tear. They are easy to keep clean and are great for water activities. I'd say I would be buying another one but I already have 3!!
customer_reviews.author: skijump23

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dry Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome! Perfect size to hold all my things. It is easy to use and I love the straps you can attach as well. I love that it comes with a phone case as well. Everything is totally waterproof. Would definitely buy again for other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Works great, colors true, straps adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: Does its job! I ordered 3 different colors in the 20 gal size. At first I was concerned about which size - just looking to use them for day excursions on the water - so I went for the middle ground and I'm completely happy with my choice. When they first arrived they looked huge, but after you roll it up and latch it closed, it's the size of a large backpack. The detachable straps are cool top, allowing you to switch from a backpack style carry to a one strap over the chest carry. Good bag, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille

customer_reviews.title: I took this dry bag and phone case with me ...
customer_reviews.text: I took this dry bag and phone case with me on a snorkel trip. It started to pour on the way back to shore, everything on the boat was wet but the inside of the dry pack and phone case stayed completely dry! I will try taking my phone in the water next time to take pictures. I don't expect a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Janna Royal

customer_reviews.title: Great service, fast ship!
customer_reviews.text: Great products and FAST shipment!!! Solid communication from this company. Ironically, I took the cell phone case on my first kayak paddle EVER and it was raining. I was so smug that my cell phone was in this case, nice dry and secure (the tether is but should be bungee cord). My wife insisted I call her when I put into landing after this first paddle, sooooo, I took the phone out of the case where it had been snug and dry, called my wife THEN MISSED the opening of the case when reinserting the phone and kerplunk, into the drink it went! LEAVE THE PHONE IN THE CASE UNTIL YOU ARE IN YOUR CAR. LOL *sigh*
customer_reviews.author: Dinghao

customer_reviews.title: excellent value
customer_reviews.text: i bought this bag for a camping canoe trip since my sea to summit bag wouldn't hold everything we needed to take. The bag performed equally well as the sea to summit, which is more than twice as expensive. i loved the handle on top and the backpack portion was helpful too. i packed 3 down sleeping bags and 3 medium camp pillows in it. all were kept completely dry after several days in a canoe and being dropped in the water.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: rubberized bags- fair quality China made
customer_reviews.text: A rubberized cloth bag of fair quality construction. The 20 L is has a volume like a small school backpack. very similar to Earth Pak but less expensive. The Bad: made in China and need a couple of days to off gas the vinyl odor. The backpack straps are cheaply made and lack any padding. There carry handle shown in the ad is missing. Closure necessitates 3 times folding over of the top and snapping it shut- no velcro aro zipper.
customer_reviews.author: George T

customer_reviews.title: First in first out!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in an actual trip to a rain forest. It is water-proof under rain. However, it is designed like a tube as the picture shows. So, while it is not difficult to load it, it is very difficult to get stuff out of the bag. Say, if your camera is at the bottom, you have to pretty much unload all the stuff above it to reach to the camera. Furthermore, it is dark deep inside and you need a flashlight to see where things are in the bag. When you close the lid per instruction by folding the top part of the bag a couple of times, the capacity of the bag reduces proportionally.
customer_reviews.author: Short Wave

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BAG!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I run OCR races and after the race my clothing and shoes are soaking wet and full of mud. I bought this bag to keep the wetness in!!! I LOVE IT!!! It is large enough to hold my shoes, clothing and a towel and keeps all of the mess in the bag and not on my other gear. I know that's not what this bag is necessarily used for but for those of us that need to keep the wet in the bag it works great!!!! I plan on showing everyone how awesome this bag is at the next race!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Northwest Soccer Bag and more.
customer_reviews.text: Really like that ultra dry bag included shoulder straps for carrying. It was a bonus getting the cell phone dry pouch. My son is using the bag for playing and refereeing soccer. Now he is ready for rain all day Saturday at the soccer field while keeping gear completely dry laying on the wet turf.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Clear

customer_reviews.title: The phone case is good too. You can use the screen of the ...
customer_reviews.text: "Good product. as advertised. quality material. I use for sailboat racing on a boat where everything gets wet. The phone case is good too. You can use the screen of the iphone 6 (normal size) without taking out of the bag. The thumb print doesn't work, so you'll enter your password old school...but that's not a big deal for me."
customer_reviews.author: Marc M

customer_reviews.title: Well made and get the job done
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these bag for my first river rafting trip and that world out grate. I got the 20L ones just in case we need to take more stuff and we did. The bags were full submerge a few times because of the heavy rapids. But everything in it was dry . All of the our towels . Food and extra clothes was dry . I would highly recommend these bags and they look great . The phone case were great too
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Canoe Backcountry Camping Trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to protect gear and phone on a recent canoe camping trip. I was very impressed on how much gear could fit in this dry bag. I got my sleeping bag and clothes in it. It did its job and kept everything dry through canoeing in the rain. I would buy this again. My husband bought a different brand dry sack for the trip and he couldn’t fit his sleeping bag in even though they were the same size. He is now going to order an Ultra Dry. The phone case worked great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't call it waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I took the bag in the water to float off the side of my innertube and after a couple of hours of use I was surprised to find all of my contents on the inside wet. Thank god I didn't have my phone in the bag otherwise it would've been dead. The next day we tried using it again and ended up with the same result. Not sure if we have a faulty bag but I don't trust this thing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Marusic

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Secure
customer_reviews.text: I carried three of these bags, lashed to my motorcycle as I crossed the TransAmerica Trail. They flawlessly survived rain storms, mud, dust, dirt, compression from my nylon tie-down straps, and even a few crashes. All of my contents remained clean and dry. I'm sure they have years of life remaining.
customer_reviews.author: Canoetripper

customer_reviews.title: Eye catching, water protectant, comfortable backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable to wear as a backpack. Not bulky. Eye catching Purchased this bag to protect my camera during heavy rain hiking trails. It’s sturdy with my equipment (sir camera, wide angle len, tripod, iPad, electronic case with extra batty and battery pack, some personal things and jacket) but not sure if it van hold anything heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Joy BayleAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Actualy works
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for the rainforest. Airtight. It rain on us, we got showered in a waterfall and when we opened our bags, everything was still dry. YAY! Plus, the dry pouch for the phone really works. Dropped the phone in the hot springs and it was totally dry when I took it out later. Only improvement I can think of is an interior pocket or two.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Tried this bag out at a lake. Looked in the bag and saw small drops of water near the lip inside the bag the first time I checked (could have fell in when I was opening it). The items were dry by the way. I threw the bag back in the water so it could float beside my kayak (in total the bag was on top of the water for about 4-5 hours). My niece actually held on to it while I rowed around in my kayak and still my items were dry. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Put these two through the test on a Whitewater rafting trip
customer_reviews.text: Work well but takes practice to seal both correctly. Splash proof and puddle proof. Did not throw my gear bag/camera phone into the river to fully test it but all came out of the bags dry and working.
customer_reviews.author: Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Dry and plenty of room, good bag
customer_reviews.text: Great dry bag, just used it on vacation... jumped off a boat with it fully loaded (phones, wallet, clothes, etc.) it floated nicely behind my head as I swam onshore... would recommend following the instructions and you'll be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Fred K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I used it for the first time ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I used it for the first time this past weekend on a motorcycle travel campout, was absolutely surprised at how much I could get in there and even then the bag wasn't puffed out. It was easy and quick to attach to my luggage rack and go down the road and yes coming back I was riding in rain, first night I kept lots of items in the bag strapped to bike and it set out in a very heavy downpour everything inside remained completely dry. I will be ordering more it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lee Owen

customer_reviews.title: This bag has so much room and keeps everything dry!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. Bought it for my trip to Kauai. Took it on our snorkeling excursion, to the beaches, and even in mud while hiking, everything stayed nice and dry. I kayak so I know this bag is going to get a lot of use. Also loved the phone case it came with used it on the snorkeling trip to take pictures..I didn't take it in the water because I have an underwater camera but I did use it on the catamaran and it got soaked, it kept my phone nice and dry. Was able to still use it to call even in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H.

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain, must have.
customer_reviews.text: This is quality kit for the price. I underestimated the size of a 20 litre bag. Do yourself a favor if you're unsure and check one out in person to get an idea of the size. The included phone case works and they are good enough to remind you to test it seals before using which I did. Only way both items could be improved would be to add some kind of built in flotation.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used this bag for an over night float trip. The second day, it rained on us on the river for over 4 hrs. Everything inside was still as dry as it went in. I only wish the had one bigger than a 30L. Phone bag worked great too. could still easily use my phone in the case.
customer_reviews.author: TherealNeil

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good quality, comfortable to wear as a backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality materials and the 20 L bag is just right for what we need. The backpack straps make it very convenient to transport to the beach or the boat. While whitewater rafting last week we secured the bag to the raft with a tether strap. During one of the larger rapids the bag bounced out of the raft and was being towed behind the raft for 10 minutes. No water entered the bag and our clothes were totally dry. I would recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Lunches stayed nice and dry
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a river clean up trip with about 20 people. Lunches stayed nice and dry. The bag is a really good weight. The cell phone case was a nice bonus. Super fast shipping. I ordered it late and was worried it wouldn't make it in time, but it did! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One for my husband and one for me. My husband is an obsessed fisherman and these come in so handy when on a lake or at the ocean. The price is great considering how much we use these. They are more durable than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Lesieur

customer_reviews.title: Great products!
customer_reviews.text: Bag was great, phone case was excellent. I used this while kayaking. The one thing that I will say is don't use the lanyard that comes with the phone case it broke very easily and I almost thought I lost my phone. But everything stayed dry, I could use my phone through the case, pictures turned out fine and I even had room for a credit card and ID. Did not have to remove my case on the phone either. ( iPhone 6) I do have a slim style case.
customer_reviews.author: P. Z Cali

customer_reviews.title: Bag is nice; cell phone case not so nice
customer_reviews.text: The bag works just fine. I used it on a hiking trip that required a lot of swimming. The items in my bag kept dry. The cell phone case, however, is garbage. The gasket at the top kept falling out and I had to continually snap it back in. Once the gasket was snapped back in and the case was closed, it kept my phone dry.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Like I said though the material is very thick and ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality dry bag. The material feels extremely durable. It will definitely take a lot of abuse and keep everything dry. Already used it for kayaking but haven't done any extensive water proof testing. Like I said though the material is very thick and durable. The phone case is an added bonus, but I already bought one that floats, but having an extra one around definitely doesn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: BKrause

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, effective dry bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first several years ago and it has been great traveling in open boats in Central / South America. These are not designed for submergence but they are great in soaking rains, boat spray and the occaisional drop in the river as you’re unloading a cayuco. On the strength of that experience I bought several more. These are great dry bags!
customer_reviews.author: Houston Bill

customer_reviews.title: not the thin material dry bag  the good stuff
customer_reviews.text: it’s a great little dry bag. perfect for paddleboarding dumped it in a few times no issues. took pics and texted with the phone case all day. it worked great too. i actually got mad at the first board i purchased. because the included phone case. had a hole in it and almost ruined my phone ! yikes anyways. love the thicker material of the dry bag. i just don’t trust. the super thin ones to hold up. i gave it only a four on durability cause i’ve only used it twice now ,, cheers !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It endured the 6.5hr Spartan Race World Championship in Tahoe.
customer_reviews.text: Hello Gill, I purchased this bag from you because I ran in the Spartan Race World Championship in Tahoe on Oct 1st 2016. The course was rough and long (15.1 miles) and involves water obstacles. I used the bag to keep my extra clothes and accessories dry. It held up for the 6.5hr race and kept my pack dry. I was curious about the "plastic" latches if they would last wearing it like a backpack for that rough of event. Even dragging it through the barbwire crawl. The seams all held so we'll see how long they last. Brandon
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for an upcoming trip to Italy I'm taking. Will be on a boat touring around some islands and wanted something to keep my dslr camera and other important items dry. I haven't used it outside yet (trip is in 2 weeks) but I did the test with a paper towel and it worked! Not a drop of water got inside. It's a pretty decent size and the color and style is really nice compared to others I've seen on Amazon. Very comfortable. Can't wait to use this hiking or to the beach. Plus they were the only ones who included a phone case too. That's always a plus!
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dry bag
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I love this dry bag. It arrived on time and the quality is so good for the price. I was expecting it to be splash proof, but I tested it out in my pool, filled with heavy items as well as tissue paper to test the waterproofness, COMPLETELY submerged it several times, threw it around, used it to float in my pool and then opened it to check if any water had leaked. NOT A DROP. highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone bags super-dry, dry bags not so much
customer_reviews.text: While the phone bags were great, the dry bags were not dry. They were rolled over 4-5 times and buckled with a towel inside in the bathtub and left to float (not submerged at all) for about 20 minutes. When opened, the insides were both wet and so were the towels.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag. Well made
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag real well. It’sa nice bag. Haven’t had a chance to use it in rain yet for bike touring but it looks well made, durable and don’t see any reason why they wouldn’t be waterproof. Don’t really care about the phone case as I don’t need it but I did test it submerged in water and it did not leak. The closure system on the phone case is very bulky. Delivery was quick. Shame it’s made in China as we need jobs here.
customer_reviews.author: Tomordr

customer_reviews.title: I love this Ultra Dry waterproof bag and phone protection as ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this Ultra Dry waterproof bag and phone protection as well. It arrived at my house quickly and will try it out on the river this weekend!!! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gregg S.

customer_reviews.title: 20L is huge
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t actually used this yet, but it appears to be of high quality. For my personal need, the 10L would have been a better size. I’m 5’ 4” with a petite build. The 20L is a bit cumbersome in comparison to my size.
customer_reviews.author: KRR

customer_reviews.title: I am quite happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am quite happy with this product. I took it out with me on my kayak for 6 hours of fishing. It is of particular importance that I have my smartphone with me and anything on my kayak is going to get wet. My phone stayed bone dry. I ordered the 10l dry bag. It is well constructed and fits easily in the hatch opening. I have no doubt that should the hull take on water this bag will keep my wallet, extra clothing, and other dry goods, dry. It comes with a carabiner and a carrying strap, both of which are necessary. It is a well designed dry bag and I am very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rudow Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: great bag....love the backpack straps
customer_reviews.text: great all around size....love the straps that can serve as temporary back pack straps. Phone case allows you to take clear pictures without removing it from the case as some others require...big plus when on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Trail Runner

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Everything Completely Dry! Great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! I took it on a trip to the Bahamas and while EVERYTHING else on the boat was soaking wet, everything in the bag was dry as can be. It was very nice on the chilly boat rides home to have warm clothing and towels. It also kept our phones, wallets, etc. dry. I did use the sack for the phone, but not fully submerged. I used it when we were wading in the water. It worked great, I just didn't have the confidence to go all the way underwater.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Halle

customer_reviews.title: Received the 10L bag - thick, high quality material ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the 10L bag - thick, high quality material that will last a long time & keep your stuff dry - but remember it is not meant to hold under water as the air will escape and water will come in. Tested the phone case by submersing in sink for 24 hrs - completely waterproof. Will be buying the 20L bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Durable and does not leak
customer_reviews.text: I race a high performance sailing dinghy . Spray. heavy salt water seas and an occasional capsize are common to this sport. I raced last week and the bag performed as stated in the description. The bag may be over built for some water sport folks who are not exposed to the elements as much. That said why have a bag that could puncture or leak and soak the contents. Great value and you get a reliable bag. Also nice to have an assortment of sizes and colors. Craig PNW area.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: My teenage granddaughters loved these.
customer_reviews.text: I gave these out to three granddaughters. One in high school, two in college. They need these to haul things back and forth to school. When they go hiking and camping and in one case, sailing. We'll see how they wear, but they appear to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big wet bag and useful phone case
customer_reviews.text: The wet bag was much bigger than I expected but it ended up working great for my purposes to take kayaking as well as store wet items after snorkeling. The phone case worked great for hours of snorkeling, though it eventually did fall apart, luckily outside the water when i was trying to put my phone (iPhone 6 with otter box) in it. But I got great footage from it! It was worth it to get the two together rather than two separate items
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I was thinking the bag would be smaller then what it showed..Actually bigger than expected to the degree that it makes me think it is too big. While that sounds like a negative it doesn’t brother me or my fiancée as there are many uses for it. I would still be careful with it as I feel that it may rip easy.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy and Mark Schroeck

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. The wall thickness is sturdy and it is a huge bag that I put all my wet stuff in to bring home in the car so the car does not get wet. I love the handle so I can easily carry the bag and all my wet stuff from sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Allison

customer_reviews.title: 20L perfect for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: The 20L is the perfect size for 2 people. We went on a 7 mile canoe run in Juniper Springs and packed some towels and food. Plus, the waterproof cellphone case was a great bonus! I kept my phone next to me and it stayed dry the whole time! Nothing in the bag ever got wet! It's easy to clean and empty and pack up, too!
customer_reviews.author: Jalain O.

customer_reviews.title: It's Great
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag and cell phone case. Big enough for a towel, sunscreen and my other random stuff that I take on my kayak. Phone is safe and I can actually text through the plastic. I don't know that I would submerge either one but everything stays dry when waves hit and I'm soaked. For the $$ it's a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Mc

customer_reviews.title: Bag so nice, I'm looking for a reason to buy a second!
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the quality of this 20L bag from the moment I pulled it out of the package. This bag is really heavy duty and built with attention to detail using quality components (buckles, webbing, etc). The phone pouch is better quality than I was expecting. It's not as rugged as the bag, but the thinner plastic allows me to actually use my phone while sealed up. I have the Samsung Galaxy Note8 and it fits (barely), even with a light weight case on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff E

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty waterproof bags
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of bags. Have used them in the kayak, as well as on vacation on power boat excursions. I can definitely say they are splash proof, and did not allow water to enter with about an inch of water in the kayak. The vinyl is heavy duty, and the seams are well fused to make it water tight. I am hoping they last a long time. The phone bag is ok, similar to others.
customer_reviews.author: fuel98rider

customer_reviews.title: Nothing worse than a Soggy Bottom .. keep it Dry !
customer_reviews.text: I am very glad I purchased this bag ! It is well made , appears very durable and the 20L size will accommadate my needs . I plan to take it camping with me .The inclusion of the Phone bag was just a big plus .. Good price , Good product , And Good folks selling it .. winner winner winner !
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Saved my butt (and my phone).
customer_reviews.text: I took my kayak out for her maiden voyage. Luckily I had put my phone and other belongings in this bag, because my kayak had an unexpected leak and I capsized. This bag kept everything dry. I did use the phone holder that came with this bag and that added an extra layer of protection. I highly recommend this bag!
customer_reviews.author: CFitzRN

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: These are great waterproof bags. I use them when I go kayaking, swimming and even took them to the beach on vacation. Never have to worry about your phone or other personal items getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: The dry bag is a very good product. The closure is as advertised "water proof"
customer_reviews.text: The dry bag is a very good product. The closure is as advertised "water proof". for first time users the instructions are printed on the bag. The smart phone bag that comes with the dry bag is an equally good product. The closure is simple but well designed. If used correctly it offers water proof protection for your electronic device. This is a great value for your kayaking or canoeing dollar.
customer_reviews.author: William Tyjewski

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for keeping things dry
customer_reviews.text: Recently took this bag on vacation to the beach. I thought it would be a great bag to hold our beach gear while we were out in the water swimming around. Bag held up great and is the perfect size (20L) to fit two large towels, some snorkel equipment, and other small goods. Had the bag on back of our scooter during a large rainfall and the bag kept everything perfectly dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Don't think, just buy! They're perfect!
customer_reviews.text: You really can't get a better deal than this! The dry bag is the perfect size and durable. The phone case is such an added plus as well, I was already planning on buying one like this, but with purchase of this dry bag, it was like I got it for free!! I'll Absolutly be purchasing more dry bags from this company in the future!
customer_reviews.author: chad keller

customer_reviews.title: A medium size bag is good for keeping 2 towels and more than enough "misc"
customer_reviews.text: Price was reasonable. Initial thoughts -- it looks great. It is completely waterproof (on the kayak, it hasn't fallen in yet! We've only been out with it once, but I think it's a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality buckle
customer_reviews.text: The bag made it through a 10 day canoe trip with tons of portages. No leakes. The buckle on the other hand never clipped right, so we had to use a carabiner to keep it shut. The free phone case worked like a charm. My phone and I took a dip a few times without any leaks your issues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished our first kayak adventure with the bag. After two kayak flips - everything inside remained perfectly dry. The shoulder strap worked great getting from car to beach. Plus the color is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JHC - Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Survived a off-road motorcycle trip strapped to my panniers on a bmw r1200gs. Plenty of drops and mud holes. Although they are covered in mud everything was nice and dry ordering more
customer_reviews.author: jason childress

customer_reviews.title: Sez what it does, Does what it sez!
customer_reviews.text: In a classic example of less is more this well made The seams and hardware are strong well placed. After close inspection you will be left with a high confidence level that this bag will keep what ever you put in it dry.
customer_reviews.author: Stevied1

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in the kayak
customer_reviews.text: Worked great in the kayak! Everything stayed dry. Plus lots of ways to hook to the kayak which was a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: D. DOWNEY

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Dry
customer_reviews.text: I bought this combo for my hike in the Narrows in Zion National Park Utah. I am very happy with both the bag and phone bag. All of my stuff stayed dry. The phone bag really worked well as I was still able to take photos with my phone while it was sealed in it. The lanyard that came with it was the right length also to be able to take photos without having to take it off every time. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: The waterproof bag works awesome. It’s perfectly behind my seat in my kayak. The phone case works great for waterproof but sometimes it is unable to use my finger touch.
customer_reviews.author: Stella82

customer_reviews.title: Dry bag = dry belongings
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my wife who loves how bright the bag is. The bag is practically air-tight when rolled correctly. We like to go kayaking and rafting and feel that this will keep her belongings safe and dry. Would recommend and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Works well for keeping things dry
customer_reviews.text: We used this out on the lake this weekend while kayaking and think it's a great dry bag. It floats well and kept all of our items dry. It's a nice size because you can fit your phone, wallet, some snacks, etc. in the bag, but it's not so big that it's bulky or hard to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly functional basic drybag - with great quality for price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality dry bag that works as advertised. The phone case, however, is very poor quality and I would not rely on it to keep my phone dry. Pros: - dry bag is rugged and works well under extreme conditions - dry bag tote straps allow it to be worn as a backpack - size (20 L) is enough for 2-3 day rafting trip carrying clothes and some supplies Cons: - phone case is good as a "backup" waterproofing - inside the other dry bag. It is most definitely not watertight as delivered
customer_reviews.author: A. Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I liked it so much I just bought another for a friend. I bought the first one three years ago and I have taken it into caves, kayaking, and to the beach. Keeps everything dry. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bag is awesome. I took it on a recent kayak trip ...
customer_reviews.text: The bag is awesome. I took it on a recent kayak trip and everything stayed dry. The phone holder isn’t so great though. It keeps the phone dry but I can’t use the touch screen on my phone. I still give it 5 stars though because I wanted the bag anyway.
customer_reviews.author: niel

customer_reviews.title: The bag is heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: so far it has kept everything dry. i havenot used it as a flotation device but I expect it would work for that too. the bonus phone carrier is fine but I didn't try to use the phone whilst inside the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Marxen

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, definitely waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Just got my dry bag and I am dang pleased with everything about it. It looks good and is solidly built. Definitely waterproof, both the bag and the phone case. I've submerged both underwater for over an hour and no water found its way in. I've used the bag and case both for a recent kayak trip and I felt comfortable knowing my junk was going to be safe and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick V.

customer_reviews.title: Do you like wet things? Because this is how you get wet things.
customer_reviews.text: Leaked like a diahhretic baby doing jumping jacks as soon as it was in the water. Kept the water in real nice, so is that a win? Maybe use it as a water bottle?
customer_reviews.author: Dan Burkhardt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous dry bag. I have only used it once so far on a waterfall hike, but it worked great. There is so much room, it's easy to use, and it's comfortable. The added phone case is awesome from what I can tell. I haven't had to use it yet but I tested it and it worked fine. Great product, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: E. Small

customer_reviews.title: Good qulity and value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction and big enough for my camera and a lens along with a small towel, glasses and t shirt. Tested the cell phone case and was completely dry after 6 hours immersed in water, Haven't tested the bigger bag but confident it will provide the protection I am looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I can honestly say that this bag and phone case have both surpassed my expectations. This bag has made it through many kayak runs and has been fully submersible along with my personal cell phone in the case and I couldn’t be more impressed and relieved. Both held true ,keeping my portable electronics, towel as well and clothing COMPLETELY dry. I’d fully recommend this bag to anyone who’s looking for DURABILITY & RELIABILITY . 2 thumbs up !
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Bought the 10L size for a recent kayak trip & it was a good thing I did because it rained a majority of the time. It's made of a good quality thick material that ensured all of my belongings stayed dry. The phone case was great too. It fit my droid turbo well & I could use the touch screen thru the case. I will probably buy additional bags for my kayaking friends!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bags
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bags. We use them for kayaking and boating and all has stayed dry. The phone bag includes instructions for a submersion test to make sure it's waterproof before real use with your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly as advertised. I really like the phone case and the dry bag. I will be taking them both to Hawaii with me tonight. I'll do some underwater pictures with my phone. If this stuff works and my phone doesn't get ruined, I'll post some pictures I took with the phone in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fields

customer_reviews.title: A five star purchase-Ultra Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: I am de this purchase specifically for a Whale Watching boat trip off the coast of Maui. As anticipated we encountered a squall that drenched most everyone and everything. The Ultra Dry Bag kept all of our valuables, paper items and other items (clothing) completely dry and intact. I recommend this bag to anyone that needs to keep items dry. This bag has proven itself to me and is simple to use. I would also recommend getting one large enough to accommodate all your items. I would rather have it be a little too large than not large enough.
customer_reviews.author: WaP

customer_reviews.title: Definitely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very durable. I took it on a 3 day canoe trip and the contents stayed dry. Phone case worked well also. I tested it in my bath tub with the water running directly onto seam and everything was still dry.
customer_reviews.author: Martyna

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: Received within 2 days, I am giving as a Christmas gift so haven't used the product yet. But have purchased ultra dry in the passed and I know it will be top notch . Thank you. Will be ordering again soon
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Duvall

product_meta.title: Ultra Dry Premium Waterproof Bag, Sack with phone dry bag and Long Adjustable Shoulder Strap Included, Perfect for Kayaking/Boating/Canoeing/Fishing/Rafting/Swimming/Camping
feature_bullets: 100% WATERPROOF DRY BAGS SET GUARANTEED keeping all your gear protected no matter what the conditions! from being plunged into white water on an extreme kayak run, hiking in torrential rain or at the beach, your gear is protected & safe.
LIGHT, TOUGH, & VERY STRONG, comfortable to carry, tear, rip and puncture proof! The perfect combination you need on your adventures, Ultra Dry Bags WILL NOT let you down like cheaper bags on Amazon!

PREMIUM QUALITY WATER PROOF BAG PHONE CASE INCLUDED worth $13 alone! fits & works superbly with all large and small smart phones like iphones 6 & samsung s6 with waterproofing quality you can depend on, ultra clear windows allow for great photos and videos. Don't trust your phone to cheap freebies!

EXTRA LONG SHOULDER STRAPS included, removable & adjustable up to 48 ins/122 cm, 4 inches longer than any other brand, easy to carry & will comfortably fit all body types, making into a handy dry bag backpack

2 YEARS UNRIVALLED CUSTOMER CARE, we take care of you better than anyone else! Making sure you are 100% delighted and the product is perfect when it reaches you. If not, ALL your money back or a replacement Guaranteed. So you have no risk! let us take care of you and add to cart now! Buy one for a friend and get free shipping!
